intro: Melandrium tatarinowii var. albiflorum, commonly known as the whiteflowered catchfly, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pink to white flowers with five petals, and its leaves are typically linear and hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
